DataElement.preferredName: Patient Disease or Disorder Assessment Clinical Trial Eligibility Criteria Code Indicator
DataElement.preferredDefinition: A response to determine patient eligibility for clinical trial participation for any questions related to the final determination of any abnormal conditions of the body or mind that cause discomfort, dysfunction, or distress to the person as outlined in the protocol.

DataElementConcept.preferredName: Patient Disease or Disorder Assessment Clinical Trial Eligibility Criteria
DataElementConcept.preferredDefinition: A person who receives medical attention, care, or treatment, or who is registered with medical professional or institution with the purpose to receive medical care when necessary._Any abnormal condition of the body or mind that causes discomfort, dysfunction, or distress to the person affected or those in contact with the person. The term is often used broadly to include injuries, disabilities, syndromes, symptoms, deviant behaviors, and atypical variations of structure and function._The final result of a determination of the value, significance, or extent of._ Characteristics which are necessary to allow a subject to participate in a clinical study, as outlined in the study protocol. The concept covers inclusion and exclusion criteria.

ObjectClass.preferredDefinition: A person who requires medical care.

Concepts.definition: A person who receives medical attention, care, or treatment, or who is registered with medical professional or institution with the purpose to receive medical care when necessary.

The term is often used broadly to include injuries, disabilities, syndromes, symptoms, deviant behaviors, and atypical variations of structure and function.

ConceptualDomain.preferredDefinition: trial-specific criteria that a patient must meet to be enrolled.

ValueDomain.preferredName: Yes No Not Applicable Code Indicator
ValueDomain.preferredDefinition: Indicator to represent a response of Yes, No, or Not Applicable._The affirmative response to a question or activity._The non-affirmative response to a question._Determination that a value is not relevant in the current context._A system of numbered categories for representation of data.

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: Determination of a value is not relevant in the current context.

Concepts.definition: Determination of a value is not relevant in the current context.

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: The non-affirmative response to a question.

Concepts.definition: The non-affirmative response to a question.

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: The affirmative response to a question or activity.

Concepts.definition: The affirmative response to a question.

ConceptualDomain.preferredDefinition: evaluations of the patient and the patient's disease.

RepresentationTerm.preferredName: Yes No Not Applicable Code Indicator
RepresentationTerm.preferredDefinition: The affirmative response to a question or activity.:The non-affirmative response to a question.:Determination that a value is not relevant in the current context.:A system of numbered categories for representation of data.:An event, entity or condition that typically characterizes a prescribed environment or situation and determines or aids in determining whether certain stated circumstances exist or criteria are satisfied.

Concepts.definition: The affirmative response to a question.
The non-affirmative response to a question.
Determination of a value is not relevant in the current context.
A symbol or combination of symbols which is assigned to the members of a collection.

An event, entity or condition that typically characterizes a prescribed environment or situation and determines or aids in determining whether certain stated circumstances exist or criteria are satisfied.

ValueDomain.changeDescription: Created to support Theradex design of CRFs for NCI CCR trials

ReferenceDocuments.name: Does patient have significant
ReferenceDocuments.description: Does patient have significant active cardiovascular or pulmonary disease at the time of study entry?

ReferenceDocuments.name: Theradex - 1
ReferenceDocuments.description: Does patient have a history of clinically relevant CNS pathology such as epilepsy, seizure, paresis, aphasia, stroke, severe brain injuries, dementia, Parkinson's disease, cerebellar disease, psychosis, or other significant CNS abnormalities?

ReferenceDocuments.name: Theradex - 4
ReferenceDocuments.description: If patient has wild type-GIST, is disease recurrent or progressive or patient is newly diagnosed with metastatic disease or newly diagnosed with residual tumor following surgical debulking?

ReferenceDocuments.name: Theradex - 3
ReferenceDocuments.description: Does patient have significant vascular disease (e.g., aortic aneurysm, requiring surgical repair or recent peripheral arterial thrombosis) within 6 months prior to Day 1?

ReferenceDocuments.name: Theradex - 2
ReferenceDocuments.description: If patient has evidence of treatment-naive AML, is patient 75 years and older with de novo or secondary AML?

ReferenceDocuments.name: Theradex - 5
ReferenceDocuments.description: Does patient have cavitation of central pulmonary lesion or radiographic evidence of pneumonisits or other extensive bilateral lung disease such as interstitial lung disease?

ReferenceDocuments.name: Theradex - 6
ReferenceDocuments.description: Does patient have any existing bleeding or condition associated with increased risk of bleeding?

ReferenceDocuments.name: Theradex - 7
ReferenceDocuments.description: Does patient have replaced and/or refractory myeloma and is experiencing disease relapse?

ReferenceDocuments.name: Theradex - 8
ReferenceDocuments.description: If patient has relapsed disease, is it refractory relapse?

ReferenceDocuments.name: Theradex - 9
ReferenceDocuments.description: Does patient have clinical stage T4 disease (tumor invades adjacent structures except seminal vesicles)?

ReferenceDocuments.name: Theradex - 11
ReferenceDocuments.description: If patient has multiple sclerosis (MS) that meets 2017 McDonald criteria for the diagnosis of multiple sclerosis (MS) (Thompson AJ, et al. Diagnosis of multiple sclerosis: 2017 revision of the McDonald criteria. Lancet Neurol. 17(2):162-173.), do they meet the inclusion/exclusion criteria in Appendix I?

ReferenceDocuments.name: Theradex - 10
ReferenceDocuments.description: Does patient have carcinoma of the neck of unknown primary site origin (regardless of HPV/p16 status)?

ReferenceDocuments.name: Theradex - 12
ReferenceDocuments.description: If patient is enrolled in the primary cohort, does patient have limited- or extensive-disease SCLC at diagnosis, with relapse at study entry?

ReferenceDocuments.name: Theradex - 13
ReferenceDocuments.description: If patient has histologic evidence of grade 1 chondrosarcoma, was it either symptomatic from their disease in the opinion of the treating investigator or demonstrate radiographic evidence of disease progression in the 3 months prior to initiation of study treatment?

ReferenceDocuments.name: Theradex - 14
ReferenceDocuments.description: Does patient have disease surrounding greater than or equal to 180 degrees of the carotid artery?

ReferenceDocuments.name: Theradex - 15
ReferenceDocuments.description: If patient is enrolled to the atezolizumab monotherapy arm and has newly diagnosed, unresectable, metastatic and measureable ASPS, does patient show clinical evidence of disease progression (including history and increasing physical symptoms) and there is on-study documentation that includes a physician's rationale that supports evidence of clinical disease progression (i.e., increasing tumor pain)?

ReferenceDocuments.name: Theradex - 16
ReferenceDocuments.description: Is patient's disease metastatic, unresectable, or for which a surgical approach would not likely confer a survival benefit or would be otherwise contraindicated?

ReferenceDocuments.name: Theradex - 17
ReferenceDocuments.description: Does patient have a) advanced or refractory solid tumor or b) lymphoma (all B cell lymphomas and T cell lymphomas other than NK-cell lymphoma) and meets standard requirements for treatment?

ReferenceDocuments.name: Theradex - 18
ReferenceDocuments.description: If patient has multiple sclerosis (MS) that meets 2017 McDonald criteria for the diagnosis of MS (Thompson AJ, et al. Diagnosis of multiple sclerosis: 2017 revision of the McDonald criteria. Lancet Neurol. 17(2):162-173.), do they meet the inclusion/exclusion criteria in Appendix I?

ReferenceDocuments.name: Theradex - 19
ReferenceDocuments.description: Does patient have lung NETs?

ReferenceDocuments.name: Theradex - 20
ReferenceDocuments.description: Does patient have an ongoing immunotherapy related colitis, uveitis, myocarditis, or pneumonitis or other immunotherapy related AEs requiring high doses of steroids (greater than 20 mg/day of prednisone or equivalent)?

DataElement.administrativeNotes:
